The Legend of the 7 Golden Vampires is a 1974 horror film produced by Hammer Studios 
and Shaw Brothers Studio. It was released in North America in an edited version as The Seven Brothers Meet Dracula, and alternatively known as The Seven Brothers and Their One Sister Meet Dracula.[1][2] The film is notable for having an actor other than Christopher Lee portray Count Dracula in the Hammer Dracula series: before this film was made, Lee left the role of the Count. The role of Dracula is played by John Forbes-Robertson (though the actor's voice is dubbed by David de Keyser)
